intro: Cylindrolobus lohitensis, commonly known as the Lohitensis Cylindrolobus, is a rare flowering plant native to the Eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive cylindrical stem and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
